result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawnee M. Chapman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:46 a.m. Defendant Shawnee M. Chapman in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Defendant Shawnee M. Chapman in custody.  Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 14cf147 and 14cf253. All parties in receipt of revocation packet. Sowinski/Richards/Court statement on sentencing. 
Court Sentence
14cf147
Jail - 6 months
Jail credit - 97 days

14cf253
Prison -  3 years
Initial Confinement - 1 -  1/2 years
Extended Supervision - 1 - 1/2 years
Jail credit - 97 days
Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program
Appeal rights given

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Shawnee M. Chapman in court with attorney Sheila Janelle Kessler.  Defendant Shawnee M. Chapman in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
9:05
Calling 14cf147,14cf253 and 14cm355
in 14cf147 - State moves to dismiss but read in counts 1 and 3 and dismiss and read in 14cm355  - Granted - Plea questionnaire filed- guilty plea to count 2 in 14cf147 and 14cf253 as charged -   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty
Bednar-Clemens/Kessler/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing - 
14CF53 - Court WHS and POP for 3 years
14CF147 - Court WHS and POP For 1 year- CC
CC/CV/Supervision fees/DNAAS  -Restitution totalling $15.29   from read in case 15cm355 - taken from bond in 14cf147 -  -  AODA and recovery as recommended - Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights given - VOting rights given
0 Credit given at this time -

1:19 p.m. Defendant Shawnee M. Chapman in court, via video, in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 14cf147, 14cf253 and 14cm355. Court questions defendant as to non-appearance.  Defendant states she had a death in family on a Wednesday after November 6, 2015. Court asks how that affected non-appearance.  Defendant states she had to go to funeral and prepare food. Michlig/Chapman statement to bail. Defendant states that her plan was to be in court for sentencing yesterday but she was picked up on warrant and had to go to jail. Court states there has been no coherent explanation as to non-appearance on November 6, 2015 and no coherent explanation to numerous warrants that have been issued. Court sets $1000 cash bond  in each of 3 cases. Adjourned Initial Appearance scheduled for December 10, 2015 at 9:00 a.m. before Judge O'Melia. Adj. 1:29 p.m.
per Mary @ ONSO - now at ONSO
Per Mary- in Vilas - awaiting transport
Plea/sentencing hearing at 12-10-2015 09:00 am
Extradition forecast- will not extradite

11:14 a.m. Attorney Sheila Janelle Kessler in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not appear.  Calling 14cf253, 14cf147, 14cm355. Attorney Kessler statement - Court authorizes arrest warrant. Adj. 11:15 a.m.
PC from Shawnee- unable to be in court today due to being out of town for family emergency- advised her to contact attorney- she hung up on me.

Attorney Sheila Janelle Kessler in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
10:55
Calling 14cf147,14cf253 and 14cm355
Bedar/Kessler statement - Defendant was picked last night up and is in Vilas County jail - Court will reset for hearing - Kessler will try to arrange a writ prior if able - depending on how long she will be in VIlas
Bail continued
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Extradition Forecast
Notified Mary at ONSO - warrant suspended until 8/27/15
to suspend warrant

2:42 pm. Attorney Sheila Janelle Kessler in court.  Jodie Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 14cf147, 14cf253, and 14cm355.  Attorney Kessler states does not know why defendant is not here today. Court authorizes warrant.  Adj. 2:43 p.m.

08:38 am - Attorney Sheila Janelle Kessler in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14cf253, 14cf147 and 14355.  Defendant does not appear.  Kessler states called defendant last night and left message on voice mail reminding of hearing this morning.  Also attempted to reach this morning, but got voice mail once again.  Kessler believes cases were resolved.  State requests warrant - Court will set a new date in August.  Adjourned 08:43 a.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Shawnee M. Chapman in court with attorney Sheila Janelle Kessler who appears telephonically.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14cf253,14cf147 and 14cm355- 
Kessler statement -   Defendant waives preliminary hearing for 14cf253 . Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over.
Bail continued on all cases -  Arraignment scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 02:00 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing at 03-04-2015 02:00 pm

11:20 am - Attorney Robert Elwood Hanson in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14cf253 and 14cf147.  Hanson in receipt of complaints, waives reading.  14cf253 will need to be set for a prelim.  Bail continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 25, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

11:43 am - Defendant Shawnee M. Chapman in court.  Attorney Hanson is running late - defendant needs to leave to appear in Milwaukee County.  Hanson will appear on her behalf on two cases when he arrives.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing time limits.  Bail continued.

01:39 pm - Defendant Shawnee M. Chapman in court, in custody.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Schiek states received call from jail stating it is believed defendant is under the influence of something.    In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant unsure as to obtaining counsel.  Court questions defendant as to if under the influence of anything.  Defendant states is not under the influence of anything, has been in jail since yesterday.  Schiek statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 6, 2015 at 11:30 am.
